newsitem.title: USA: Clinton to promote religious freedom.
newsitem.headline: Clinton to promote religious freedom.

text.p: President Clinton will urge federal agencies Thursday to give government employees as much freedom as possible to engage in religious worship in the workplace, a White House official said.
Clinton, who is scheduled to speak on the subject at 10 a.m. EDT (1400 GMT) on the White House south lawn, plans to issue a memo to the heads of government agencies giving them three instructions:
-- to permit employees to engage in personal religious expression to the greatest extent possible;
-- to reasonably accommodate workers' religious practices, including religious holidays, prayers and the Sabbath;
-- and to prohibit federal employers from coercing workers to join in religious worship.

The White House official, who asked not to be named, said several religious and civil liberties groups would attend the announcement, including the Commission on Law and Social Action of the American Jewish Congress, the Center for Law and Religious Freedom and the National Council of Churches.
